page.title: 11Home life Chaldon Hills
page.content: Apart from the Army Camp (see Armed Forces) the homes are isolated one from another and from shops. This results in households becoming either self-sufficient as much as possible, or totally dependant on travelling to major population centres such as Bournemouth, Poole, Wareham and Dorchester for their needs. With no pressure on land use, large gardens are used to grow vegetables and keep chickens. Electricity and mains water are available to all homes. Television is the only source of entertainment available within the block which is not self-created. Isolation can create difficulties in periods of severe weather and it is necessary to keep adequate stocks of supplies available in the home during the winter months.
